DOC.brief_summary: Multicentric cohort study recruiting patients admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) with acute respiratory failure (ARF) and receiving treatment with high-flow nasal cannula (HFNC). This is a second part of the initial study PF(AG)101/2011 where the investigators created the ROX index to predict the need of failure with HFNC treatment in patients with ARF secondary to pneumonia, and the investigators want to validate ROX index with this second prospective cohort results.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Validation of the ROX Index
DOC.detailed_description: This is a second part of the initial study PF(AG)101/2011 where the investigators created the ROX index to predict the need of failure with HFNC treatment in patients with ARF secondary to pneumonia, and the investigators want to validate ROX index with this second prospective cohort results. The investigators are now recruiting a second cohort of patients prospectively in order to analyse results and validate ROX index.
DOC.criteria: patients admitted in the ICU under ARF situation receiving treatment with HFNC under 18 years old intubated and mechanically ventilated previously of 24h before HFNC treatment started limitation of therapeutic effort immediate intubation after ICU arrival
